docs.title: What's New

docs.text: Changelog ¶ In version 2 we have made major changes to our template. we use nodejs package manager, why we use package manager? because you can add dependencies or delete our default dependencies easily and you can use them flexibly [1.0.0] First Realease [1.1.0] [-] Depreceted Personal Info in [main.js] file [+] Dark Mode save in Local Storage [2.0.0] System change Now using package manager nodejs Using typescript technology Using sass technology [+] added webpack [+] added local server [+] added sass compiler what is nodejs As an asynchronous event-driven JavaScript runtime, Node.js is designed to build scalable network applications. In the following "hello world" example, many connections can be handled concurrently. Upon each connection, the callback is fired, but if there is no work to be done, Node.js will sleep. Read more what is typescript TypeScript is a programming language developed and maintained by Microsoft. It is a strict syntactical superset of JavaScript and adds optional static typing to the language. It is designed for the development of large applications and transpiles to JavaScript. what is sass Sass (which stands for 'Syntactically awesome style sheets) is an extension of CSS that enables you to use things like variables, nested rules, inline imports and more. It also helps to keep things organised and allows you to create style sheets faster. Sass is compatible with all versions of CSS what is webpack Webpack is a tool that lets you compile JavaScript modules, also known as module bundler. Given a large number of files, it generates a single file (or a few files) that run your app. It can perform many operations: helps you bundle your resources. watches for changes and re-runs the tasks.
docs.title: Changelog

docs.text: In version 2 we have made major changes to our template. we use nodejs package manager, why we use package manager? because you can add dependencies or delete our default dependencies easily and you can use them flexibly [1.0.0] First Realease [1.1.0] [-] Depreceted Personal Info in [main.js] file [+] Dark Mode save in Local Storage [2.0.0] System change Now using package manager nodejs Using typescript technology Using sass technology [+] added webpack [+] added local server [+] added sass compiler what is nodejs As an asynchronous event-driven JavaScript runtime, Node.js is designed to build scalable network applications. In the following "hello world" example, many connections can be handled concurrently. Upon each connection, the callback is fired, but if there is no work to be done, Node.js will sleep. Read more what is typescript TypeScript is a programming language developed and maintained by Microsoft. It is a strict syntactical superset of JavaScript and adds optional static typing to the language. It is designed for the development of large applications and transpiles to JavaScript. what is sass Sass (which stands for 'Syntactically awesome style sheets) is an extension of CSS that enables you to use things like variables, nested rules, inline imports and more. It also helps to keep things organised and allows you to create style sheets faster. Sass is compatible with all versions of CSS what is webpack Webpack is a tool that lets you compile JavaScript modules, also known as module bundler. Given a large number of files, it generates a single file (or a few files) that run your app. It can perform many operations: helps you bundle your resources. watches for changes and re-runs the tasks.
docs.title: Changelog

docs.text: Command Line ¶ compiling module javascript just type in command line npm run build watch module javascript just type in command line npm run webpack-serve compiling scss or sass just type in command line npm run compile watch scss or sass just type in command line npm run watch running local server just type in command line npm run serve open browser http://localhost:8080 running documentation local server just type in command line npm run docs-serve open browser http://localhost:5000
docs.title: Command Line

docs.text: compiling module javascript just type in command line npm run build watch module javascript just type in command line npm run webpack-serve compiling scss or sass just type in command line npm run compile watch scss or sass just type in command line npm run watch running local server just type in command line npm run serve open browser http://localhost:8080 running documentation local server just type in command line npm run docs-serve open browser http://localhost:5000
docs.title: Command Line

docs.text: Installation ¶ Note Before using this theme you have to install nodejs Install a theme’s dependencies from your command line via npm. type npm install Run a npm build to packing using webpack for more detail visit official documentation How to running local server ¶ after install dependencies, now you can running a local server without instalation plugin, in command line type npm run serve How to running local server with plugin [Alternative] ¶ you can also use alternative way using plugin from code editor visual studio code install the code editor Visual Studio Code (download similar with your operating system) install the plugin Live Server Method 1 ¶ Open a project and click to Go Live from the status bar to turn the server on/off. Method 2 ¶ Open a HTML file and right-click on the editor and click on Open with Live Server. Method 3 ¶ Hit alt+L, alt+O to Open the Server and alt+L, alt+C to Stop the server (You can change the shortcut form keybinding). [On MAC, cmd+L, cmd+O and cmd+L, cmd+C]
docs.title: Installation

docs.text: Note Before using this theme you have to install nodejs Install a theme’s dependencies from your command line via npm. type npm install Run a npm build to packing using webpack for more detail visit official documentation
docs.title: Installation

docs.text: after install dependencies, now you can running a local server without instalation plugin, in command line type npm run serve
docs.title: How to running local server

docs.text: you can also use alternative way using plugin from code editor visual studio code install the code editor Visual Studio Code (download similar with your operating system) install the plugin Live Server
docs.title: How to running local server with plugin [Alternative]

docs.text: Open a project and click to Go Live from the status bar to turn the server on/off.
docs.title: Method 1

docs.text: Open a HTML file and right-click on the editor and click on Open with Live Server.
docs.title: Method 2

docs.text: Hit alt+L, alt+O to Open the Server and alt+L, alt+C to Stop the server (You can change the shortcut form keybinding). [On MAC, cmd+L, cmd+O and cmd+L, cmd+C]
docs.title: Method 3

docs.text:
Modify content ¶ Change Icon ¶ change it you can change it with a new url in the href attribute index.html (public\index.html) # Source index.html Change Image / Avatar ¶ change it you can change it with a new url in the img href attribute File index.html (public\index.html) # Source index.html
File about.html (public\about.html) # Source about.html
` Change Color ¶ :root { --bs-primary: #ff6b6b; --bs-primary-hov: #df5c5c; --bs-blue-dark: #263449; } Change Font ¶ if you want to change the font type open the main.scss file, you will find @import url() in the double quote or single quote input brackets and the font url. You can find fonts at Google Fonts @import url("https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Poppins:ital,wght@0,300;0,400;0,500;0,600;0,700;1,300;1,400;1,500;1,600;1,700&display=swap"); change the font-family with your name font input in @import url("...") Change Background Image ¶ in the main.scss file you will find body and background-image: in url with double quote instead put the url image & section.blog-page > .modal { background-image: url("../img/Gradient-3.jpg"); # change this to change the background } main.scss (src/assets/scss/main.scss) ¶ body { background-size: cover; background-repeat: no-repeat; font-family: "Poppins"; &, & section.blog-page > .modal { background-image: url("../img/Gradient-3.jpg"); # change this to change the background }
docs.title: Modify content

docs.text: change it you can change it with a new url in the href attribute index.html (public\index.html) # Source index.html <link rel="shortcut icon" href="assets/img/logo.png" type="image/x-icon" />
docs.title: Change Icon
